item.title: MRAID Vendor Tag Certification Process

item.title: Marketplace Best Practices
item.description: Why enable Marketplace? MoPub Marketplace is our real-time bidding exchange, which gives publishers access to an additional revenue source through a competitive auction with complete transparency and control. MoPub’s...

item.title: Custom Native Network Setup
item.description: MoPub supports 3rd party Ad Network SDKs through a Custom Native Network implementation. If an Ad Network not listed provides their solution through an SDK, the network may be integrated leveraging MoPub’s Custom Events. The integration of Custom Native Networks requires the development...

item.title: Ad Network Setup
item.description: MoPub allows for the set-up and management of multiple Ad Networks through the MoPub Dashboard. Ad Networks will serve ads to the ad unit ID that is referenced. From within the dashboard, click the Networks tab. From your Network tab, click “Add a Network” MoPub...

item.title: What is MoPub?
item.description: What is MoPub? MoPub is a mobile ad serving platform. We help you monetize your apps more effectively. We offer a free, self-serve product that lets you get started with ad serving quickly while offering sophisticated features that you will need as you grow. With streamlined campaign management,...

item.title: Scripting: Events
item.description: By using Twitter Javascript, you agree to the Developer Rules of the Road. By default, widgets-js will find mark-up in a page and convert basic, functional mark-up into rich interactive widgets. In addition, there are a number of functions of widgets-js that allow developers to work with Twitter...

item.title: Technical Integration FAQ
item.description: I’m testing my ad unit and nothing is happening. Why? At the moment, ad units that aren't receiving ad requests from live traffic get removed from our ad servers periodically. When the ad unit starts receiving traffic again, the information gets loaded on those machines and there's a...

item.title: How To Integrate Facebook Audience Network Using Custom Events
item.description: You can work with Facebook's Audience Network using Custom Events the same way you can with other ad network on MoPub. MoPub's pre-built Custom Event adapter makes this process even simpler. For more information on Custom Events, see Setting Up Ad Networks. Important Note: These Custom...

item.title: Server to Server Network Support
item.description: MoPub provides Server to Server integrations with the following networks:   Jumptap   InMobi   MobFox   Tapit   Mojiva    Huntmads   This means that there is no additional development work required. Once you have created an account with a...

item.title: Ad Networks FAQ
item.description: What networks does MoPub support? MoPub supports dozens of the most popular ad networks via server-to-server connections. For a list of standard supported networks, visit here. In addition to these networks, you can set up any network on MoPub via a "Custom Event". These...

item.title: MoPub Macros
item.description: MoPub supports the following macros for a publisher’s 3rd party ad tags and trackers:   Click URL (Unescaped):  %%CLICK_URL_UNESC%%    Click URL (Escaped):  %%CLICK_URL_ESC%%   Cache Buster (Generates a random number): %%CACHEBUSTER%%   Ad...

item.title: AdMarvel Integration
item.description: AdMarvel SDK When using the AdMarvel SDK, passing IFA and AndroidID can dramatically affect Marketplace performance. The versions below are certified to work correctly with Marketplace: iOS: AdMarvel SDK version 3.0.1 and higher is required to pass IDFA Android: All...

item.title: Checking the MoPub SDK Version
item.description: Checking the MoPub SDK Version As a best practice, we recommend that you update to the most recent version of the MoPub SDK every time you push an update to the Apple App Store or Google Play Store. To check the version of the SDK that is currently integrated in your...

item.title: Reporting
item.description: The MoPub reporting tool can be found here or by clicking ‘Reports’ under Your Account.   Reports can be broken down using up to three different type of paramaters   Please note that data for yesterday becomes available at 12:00PM Pacific Time   You can...

item.title: Tweet Button parameter reference
item.description: A Tweet Button supports prepopulating share text, hashtags, and a Twitter account reference. Associate related Twitter accounts to drive followers. Tweet content parameters in_reply_to optional Status ID string of a parent Tweet such as a Tweet from your account (if applicable). Example...

item.title: Twitter | MoPub Server-to-Server API Technical Specifications 1.0
item.description: Overview The MoPub Server-to-Server API makes it easier for ad networks and demand partners to connect with the MoPub platform outside of SDK libraries. To integrate with MoPub through the Server-to-Server API, follow the integration approval process and technical specifications...

item.title: Generating Ad Unit Code for Integration
item.description: From the Ad Unit page, you can pull the ad unit code by clicking “Code Integration”. Once all your ad units have been created, you can follow our technical guide to begin integration of the SDK.

item.title: Embedded Tweet parameter reference
item.description: An Embedded Tweet supports customization in data-* attributes and JavaScript factory functions. This reference document describes parameters used in all formats. Reference the oEmbed API to set these parameters as part of an HTML response for a Tweet ID or URL. Parameters id required The...

item.title: Create an Ad Unit
item.description: Your application will require one or more Ad Units in order to show ads. From your Inventory tab, click “Add a New App” Select your platform choice in the Device Format section Select Ad Format type...
